meanings.definition: A piece of land farmed communally under a system supported by the Mexican government.
meanings.sent1: The villagers worked together on the ejidos to grow crops for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The ejidos in Mexico are essential for ensuring fair distribution of resources.
meanings.sent3: The ejidos were so popular that even the animals wanted to join in on the farming fun.
meanings.sent4: The ejidos stood as a symbol of unity and cooperation among the community.
meanings.sent5: The lush green ejidos stretched as far as the eye could see, a testament to shared labor and shared rewards.

meanings.definition: A communal farm or cooperative in Mexico.
meanings.sent1: The local community gathered at the ejidos to plan the next harvest.
meanings.sent2: Visiting the ejidos was always a highlight of the trip to Mexico.
meanings.sent3: The ejidos were so productive that even the birds wanted to lend a wing in farming.
meanings.sent4: The ejidos blossomed with life, a vibrant hub of collective effort.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh earth filled the air at the ejidos, a reminder of shared toil and shared success.

meanings.definition: A system of communal land ownership in Mexico.
meanings.sent1: The ejidos ensured that no one person could claim ownership of the land.
meanings.sent2: The system of ejidos promoted equality and cooperation among farmers.
meanings.sent3: The ejidos were so fair that even the sun seemed to shine brighter on them.
meanings.sent4: The concept of ejidos rooted deeply in the Mexican tradition of community.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries of the ejidos blurred, symbolizing the unity of the people who worked the land together.
